name: Archaic and Old Egypt Multiple Choice Quiz | Ancient History | 10 Questions

questions.text: The unification of Upper and Lower Egypt occurred under the reign of Menes, alternatively known as what?
questions.explanation:
Narmer.

	Narmer, whose reign is placed at approximately 3100 B.C., is depicted on a votive palette as the victor of a great struggle.

questions.text: Royal tombs of the Archaic Period (ca. 3100-2686 B.C.), found at Saqqara, among other sites, are known by what name?
questions.explanation:
Mastabas.

	Eventually these were replaced by the great building projects that led to the pyramids.

questions.text: The first capital of ancient Egypt was established at Memphis, a city whose name can be translated roughly into English as what?
questions.explanation:
White Walls.

	Memphis can be found at the apex of the Nile delta...and was established by Menes himself, or so the rumors say...

questions.text: At Saqqara, a step pyramid was built by the famous architect Imhotep for which king of the Third Dynasty?
questions.explanation:
Djoser.

	Imhotep is the earliest known architect to appear in documented history.

questions.text: The largest pyramid of ancient Egypt, at Giza, was built for the Pharoah Khufu. What is the Greek derivation of his name?
questions.explanation:
Cheops & Keops & Kheops.

	The great pyramid, built for Khufu, was the first of the Seven Ancient Wonders to be constructed.

questions.text: The second largest pyramid at Giza was built during the reign of an Egyptian Pharaoh of the 4th dynasty sometime in the 26th century. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Khafre.

	The pyramid of Menkaure, Khafre's son, is the third largest.

questions.text: The term used for the rulers of Egypt, Pharaoh, has what meaning in English translation?
questions.explanation:
Great House.

	Pharaohs were absolute rulers, considered to be living gods by the people of ancient Egypt.

questions.text: The sun-god Ra (or Re) originated in which city of ancient Egypt?
questions.explanation:
Heliopolis.

	Heliopolis could be found just north of present-day Cairo.

questions.text: The 5th dynasty gave rise to an important official who ranked second only to the king himself, and sometimes eclipsed the power of the ruler. What was this official called?
questions.explanation:
Vizier.

	In some cases, the Vizier held more actual power than the Pharaoh...this of course was when political trouble would arise!

questions.text: The last great Pharoah of the Old Kingdom of Egyptian history was also the longest reigning monarch, and went by what name?
questions.explanation:
Pheops II.

	Pheops II is alternatively known as Pepi II....he reigned approximately 90 years!  He was the last ruler of the Sixth Dynasty of the Old Kingdom.  Thanks for trying the quiz, I hope you enjoyed it.  If you did, please give my other ancient history quizzes a try.
